intro: Elaphoglossum craspedotum, commonly known as the fringed holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive fringed appearance along the margins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are arranged in a unique linear pattern on the underside of the fronds. Elaphoglossum craspedotum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, showcasing its adaptability to humid climates.
